question: What does the abbreviation HTML stand for?
answer: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.

question: How many sizes of headers are available in HTML by default?
answer: 6 headers are available in HTML by default ranging from h1 to h6.

question: What is the smallest header in HTML by default?
answer: h6 is the smallest header in HTML by default.

question: What are the types of lists available in HTML?
answer: The lists available in HTML are Ordered and Unordered List.

question: How to create an ordered list in HTML?
answer: An ordered list is created in HTML by using the <ol> tag.

question: HTML files are saved by default with the extension?
answer: HTML files are saved by the .html or .htm extension.

question: We enclose HTML tags within?
answer: HTML tags are enclosed within < > according to syntax.

question: What is the effect of the <b> tag?
answer: <b> is used to convert the text within it to bold font.
options: It converts the text within it to bold font.
It is used to write black-colored font.
It is used to change the font size.

question: Which of the following is correct about HTML?
answer: HTML can only use the tags defined within the language.
options: HTML uses tags defined within the language.

question: How to display preformatted text in HTML?
answer: <pre> tags is used to handle preformatted text in HTML.

question: What is meant by an empty tag in HTML?
answer: In HTML, empty tags are those tags that don’t require a closing tag for completion.
options: There is no such concept of an empty tag in HTML
An empty tag does not require a closing tag
An empty tag cannot have any content within it

question: What are the attributes used to change the size of an image?
answer: Width and Height attributes are used to change the size of an image.

question: Which attribute is used to provide a unique name to an HTML element?
answer: An id is used to provide a unique name for an HTML element that can be used to identify it.

question: What is the function of the HTML style attribute?
answer: The HTML style attribute is used to add styles like font, color, and size to an HTML element.
options: It is used to add styles to an HTML element.
It is used to uniquely identify some specific styles of some element.

question: Which of the following is the correct syntax for using the HTML style attribute?
answer: The correct syntax for the style attribute is shown in Option A.

question: Which HTML element is used to define description data?
answer: Description data is defined by <dd> tag.

question: Which of the following properties is used to change the font of text?
answer: The font-family property is used to change text font in HTML

question: How are quotations defined in HTML?
answer: The <blockquote> tag is used to define a section that is quoted from another source.

question: What tag is used to render an image on a webpage?
answer: The img tag is used to display an image on a webpage.

question: Apart from <i> tag, which of the following tag is used to render a text in italics?
answer: The <em> tag is used to emphasize text, which puts same effect as <i> tag.

question: What is the correct syntax to write an HTML comment?
answer: The correct syntax of writing an HTML comment is shown in option A.

question: Colors are defined in HTML using?
answer: Colors are defined using RGB, HEX, HSL, RGBA, HSLA values or with predefined color names.

question: Which property is used to set colors in HTML?
answer: The color property is used to set and change colors in HTML.

question: What are the types of unordered lists in HTML?
answer: The unordered lists in HTML can form bullets of form Circle, Square and Disc.

question: Which property is used to set border colors in HTML?
answer: The border property is used to change the border properties, including color in HTML.

question: Which of the following things are necessary to create an HTML page?
answer: With a text editor and a web browser we can create an HTML page.

question: Which of the following tags is used to indicate the page’s start and endpoints?
answer: <html> tag indicates the web browser where a webpage starts and ends.

question: Which of the following is true about HTML tags?
answer: HTML tags are not case-sensitive in nature.

question: Which HTML tag is called the root element of an HTML document?
answer: The <html> tag is the root element of an HTML document, which means that it contains all the contents and tags of the HTML document within it.

question: How is black color represented in terms of RGB values?
answer: RCB(0, 0, 0) is equivalent to black color in terms of RGB values.

question: What does the Alpha value in RGBA represent?
answer: A in RGBA represents the value of the Alpha Channel which is a measure of the Opacity of a color.

question: What does the Alpha value of 0.0 represent?
answer: The Alpha value varies between 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0(fully opaque).

question: How to set a font for a whole page?
answer: <defaultfont> tag is used to set up a default font type for a whole page.

question: The CSS inside HTML elements used alongside style attribute is called?
answer: The CSS used alongside the style attribute with HTML elements is called Inline CSS.

question: Which of the following colors contain equal amounts of RBG?
answer: Gray is RGB(50, 50, 50), White is RGB(100, 100, 100) and Black is RGB(0, 0, 0).

question: What is the speciality about the <small> and <big> tags in HTML?
answer: The tags can be repeated and their effects and stacked on top of each other.
options: They can be used for text only.

question: Which of the following tags is used to add a row to a table in HTML?
answer: <tr> is used to add a row to a table in HTML.

question: Which property allows an image link to show a text label?
answer: The alt property allows an image link to show a text label.

question: If a background image is smaller than the screen on which it is being displayed, what will occur on the webpage?
answer: By default on most screens, if the background image is smaller than the screen on which it is being displayed, the image will be repeated.
options: The blank space will be shown in black.

question: How many characters can be written in 1KB?
answer: 1024 characters can be written in a file of size 1KB.

answer: All of the above options are examples of valid character sets.

question: The default value of the BORDER attribute is?
answer: 1pixel is the default value for the BORDER attribute in HTML.

question: What are those objects called which are used for storing data on the client provided by the HTML local storage?
answer: Such objects with the property mentioned above are called as Windows.localStorage or Window.sessionStorage.

question: The most basic part of any HTML page is?
answer: ASCII Text comprises the most basic part of any HTML page, as it is the simplest character set a webpage can use.

question: What is the select tag used for?
answer: A HTML combo box is created using the select tag.
options: Select some attributes and change their style.

question: What are the main components of the front end of any working website?
answer: HTML, CSS, and Javascript combined to form the basic components of any working website’s frontend.

question: Which HTML tag is used to set up a Javascript-like client-side scripting language?
answer: <script> tag is used for the purpose of setting up a client-side scripting language.
